intro: Psychotria konkourensis, commonly known as the Kombu plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. Psychotria konkourensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical significance in traditional medicine.
